title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 78.3 - Limited permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 78.3 - Limited permits

State Regulations

The department may issue a limited permit in massage, as
provided in section
7806
of the

Education Law, to applicants who have been admitted to the licensing
examination and who have not previously failed such examination. (a) The limited permit is valid for no more
than 12 months or until the results of the next licensing examination for which
the applicant is eligible are officially available. It is not
renewable. (b) Personal
supervision, as used in section
7806
(3)
of the Education Law, shall mean that a
supervising massage therapist shall be present on the premises at all times
when professional massage therapist services are being rendered by the holder
of the limited permit, and shall exercise that degree of supervision
appropriate to the circumstances. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
78.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
